name: Avoid large Methods - too many Lines of Code (Kotlin)
description:
Methods should not have more than X lines of code.
The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
output:
This report lists all Methods with more than X lines of code
It provides the following information: Method full name, number of lines of code
rationale: Large methods are more difficult to understand, and are a sign of a bad modularity of the code.
remediation: Review the design of the method to reduce its size
alternativeName: Ensure to implement limited functionality in a method

technicalCriteria.name: CWE-1080: Source Code File with Excessive Number of Lines of Code

qualityStandards.name: Source Element Excessive Size
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid over-sizing of software elements

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of modularity causes excessive propagation of modification impacts

Measure Element
Number of instances where a file has too many lines of code based on a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of lines of code is 1000
